column.name: id
column.remarks: The ID of the achievement.

column.name: order
column.remarks: The order in which the achievement is displayed to the user.

column.name: name_key
column.remarks: The message key for the name of the achievement.

column.name: description_key
column.remarks: The message key for the description of the achievement.

column.name: type
column.remarks: The type of the achievement. Possible values are: "STANDARD" - Achievement is either locked or unlocked. "INCREMENTAL" - Achievement is incremental.

column.name: total_steps
column.remarks: The total steps for an incremental achievement, NULL for standard achievements.

column.name: revealed_icon_url
column.remarks: The image URL for the revealed achievement icon.

column.name: unlocked_icon_url
column.remarks: The image URL for the unlocked achievement icon.

column.name: initial_state
column.remarks: The initial state of the achievement. Possible values are: "HIDDEN" - Achievement is hidden. "REVEALED" - Achievement is revealed. "UNLOCKED" - Achievement is unlocked.

column.name: experience_points
column.remarks: Experience points which will be earned when unlocking this achievement. Multiple of 5. Reference: 5 - Easy to achieve 20 - Medium 50 - Hard to achieve

table.name: avatars
table.remarks: Assign avatars (avatars_list) to users (login)

column.name: expires_at
column.remarks: If null the avatar is permanent

table.name: avatars_list
table.remarks: List of all available avatars

table.name: ban
table.remarks: ban can be revoked, see ban_revoke

column.name: expires_at
column.remarks: If null, the ban is permanent

column.name: report_id
column.remarks: The report based on which the ban was issued, is NULL if ban was not issues due to a report

column.name: founder_id
column.remarks: The initial creator of the clan

column.name: leader_id
column.remarks: Current leader/admin of the clan

column.name: tag_color
column.remarks: RGB color code for the clan's tag in chat

column.name: type
column.remarks: deprecated, lookup parent scenario instead

column.name: scenario_id
column.remarks: TODO: Make not null after migration

table.name: coop_scenario
table.remarks: A scenario is the parent of one or multiple related missions.

column.name: type
column.remarks: SC=vanilla Supreme Commander campaign, SCFA=Forged Alliance campaign, CUSTOM=community campaign

column.name: faction
column.remarks: Describes the faction to be played in the scenario. Custom means the user can select a faction.

table.name: coturn_servers
table.remarks: List of coturn servers to be propagated to ICE adapters

column.name: region
column.remarks: Region of the server for simple user-based selection if latency checks don't work

column.name: preshared_key
column.remarks: Should be only accessible to clients with lobby scope.

column.name: contact_email
column.remarks: Email of the responsible server administrator

column.name: id
column.remarks: The ID of the event.

column.name: name_key
column.remarks: The message key for the name of the event.

column.name: image_url
column.remarks: The base URL for the image that represents the event.

column.name: type
column.remarks: The type of the event. Possible values are: "NUMERIC" - Event is a plain number. "TIME" - Event is a measure of time.

column.name: id
column.remarks: This table is managed by Flyway. Do not manually edit records.

column.name: order
column.remarks: Order in the featured mods list

column.name: git_url
column.remarks: The git repository URL to load this mod from

column.name: git_branch
column.remarks: The repository branch that contains the latest version

column.name: allow_override
column.remarks: Whether overriding an existing version is allowed (1) or not (0).

column.name: deployment_webhook
column.remarks: A webhook to be called after successfull deployment

table.name: game_reviews_summary
table.remarks: Summary of all game reviews. Entries are created and updated by triggers.

column.name: positive
column.remarks: The 'positive' share of the rating

column.name: negative
column.remarks: The 'negative' share of the rating

column.name: score
column.remarks: The sum of all scores

column.name: reviews
column.remarks: The sum of all 'negative' and 'positive' shares. Equals to the number of reviews.

column.name: lower_bound
column.remarks: Lower bound of Wilson score confidence interval for a Bernoulli parameter

column.name: replay_ticks
column.remarks: The total number of ticks present in the replay. The SCFA tick rate is 10 ticks/second

column.name: replay_available
column.remarks: If false, no replay is available for download. The replay server needs to set this field to true once replay is written to disk.

table.name: global_rating_rank_view
table.remarks: Materialized view including ranks (player position) for global_rating

column.name: id
column.remarks: References to global_rating.id

table.name: group_permission
table.remarks: List of all permissions, assigned over group assignments (group_permission_assignments)

column.name: id
column.remarks: This table is managed by Flyway. Do not manually edit records.

column.name: technical_name
column.remarks: hardcoded names to be used in code

column.name: name_key
column.remarks: name key of permission in translation table

table.name: group_permission_assignment
table.remarks: Connects groups (user_group) and permissions (group_permission)

table.name: ladder1v1_rating_rank_view
table.remarks: Materialized view including ranks (player position) for ladder1v1_rating

column.name: id
column.remarks: References to ladder1v1_rating.id

column.name: id
column.remarks: This table is managed by Flyway. Do not manually edit records.

column.name: description_key
column.remarks: The leaderboard's i18n description key

column.name: initializer_id
column.remarks: Initialize rating based on existing entries from another leaderboard.

table.name: license
table.remarks: Copyright licenses to be picked for uploaded content

column.name: license_text
column.remarks: The full license text formatted in Markdown

column.name: active
column.remarks: Can this license be selected for new uploads?

column.name: revocable
column.remarks: Can the author revoke this license?

column.name: redistributable
column.remarks: Are other users (apart from FAF) allowed to redistribute this asset?

column.name: modifiable
column.remarks: Are other users allowed to publish assets remixed, transformed, or built upon the material from this asset?

column.name: group
column.remarks: 0 - no privileges; 1 - moderator, can delete/edit comments and approve broken maps reports; 2 - admin, same as moderator plus can add global bans

table.name: lobby_ban
table.viewSql: select `faf`.`ban`.`player_id` AS `idUser`,`faf`.`ban`.`reason` AS `reason`,coalesce(`faf`.`ban`.`revoke_time`,`faf`.`ban`.`expires_at`,cast('2999-12-31' as date)) AS `expires_at` from `faf`.`ban` where `faf`.`ban`.`level` = 'GLOBAL'

column.name: gog_id
column.remarks: Username on gog.com

table.name: login_log
table.remarks: Log of logins to discover login attack attempts. Has to be cleaned up by the services.

column.name: id
column.remarks: ID for API/Elide compatibility

column.name: login_string
column.remarks: In case of unknown login, the login name will be kept here

column.name: games_played
column.remarks: Number of times a map version has been played. Should be updated each time games_played is updated in map_version Values start at 0

column.name: recommended
column.remarks: Boolean to indicate if a map is a high quality FAF Map

column.name: create_time
column.remarks: When this entry was created.

column.name: update_time
column.remarks: When this entry was updated

table.name: map_pool
table.remarks: A collection of maps, used by a matchmaker_pool for map selection

column.name: name
column.remarks: Only to help admins with organization. Don't show this to the user.

column.name: map_version_id
column.remarks: When null the map_params will be used to generate the map

column.name: weight
column.remarks: Integer relative weight to select the map. If all values equal there will be a uniform chance. Values default to 1

column.name: map_params
column.remarks: json string which defines the type of map as well as the parameters for the map in the case of generated maps this would be the version, the generator type (e.g. neroxis), the size in pixels (e.g. 512) and the spawns

table.name: map_statistic
table.viewSql: select `mv`.`map_id` AS `id`,count(0) AS `times_played`,`m`.`create_time` AS `create_time`,current_timestamp() AS `update_time` from ((`faf`.`game_stats` join `faf`.`map_version` `mv` on(`faf`.`game_stats`.`mapId` = `mv`.`id`)) join `faf`.`map` `m` on(`mv`.`map_id` = `m`.`id`)) group by `mv`.`map_id`

column.name: create_time
column.remarks: When this entry was created.

table.name: map_statistics
table.viewSql: select `faf`.`map`.`id` AS `map_id`,0 AS `downloads`,`faf`.`map`.`games_played` AS `plays`,0 AS `draws` from `faf`.`map`

column.name: plays
column.remarks: Number of times a map version has been played. Should be updated each time games_played is updated in map_version Values start at 0

column.name: games_played
column.remarks: Number of times a map version has been played. Should be updated each time a row is inserted with the map_version.id in game_stats. Values start at 0

column.name: create_time
column.remarks: When this entry was created.

column.name: update_time
column.remarks: When this entry was updated

table.name: map_version_reviews_summary
table.remarks: Summary of all map version reviews. Entries are created and updated by triggers.

column.name: positive
column.remarks: The 'positive' share of the rating

column.name: negative
column.remarks: The 'negative' share of the rating

column.name: score
column.remarks: The sum of all scores

column.name: reviews
column.remarks: The sum of all 'negative' and 'positive' shares. Equals to the number of reviews.

column.name: lower_bound
column.remarks: Lower bound of Wilson score confidence interval for a Bernoulli parameter

table.name: map_version_statistics
table.viewSql: select `faf`.`map_version`.`id` AS `map_version_id`,0 AS `downloads`,`faf`.`map_version`.`games_played` AS `plays`,0 AS `draws` from `faf`.`map_version`

column.name: plays
column.remarks: Number of times a map version has been played. Should be updated each time a row is inserted with the map_version.id in game_stats. Values start at 0

table.name: matchmaker_queue
table.remarks: A matchmaker queue specifying which featured mod will be played, which map pools will be drawn from, and which leaderboard will be used to look up and update a player''s rating.

column.name: id
column.remarks: This table is managed by Flyway. Do not manually edit records.

column.name: params
column.remarks: json string which defines additional parameters for the queue

table.name: matchmaker_queue_map_pool
table.remarks: Map sub pool of a rating range for a matchmaker queue

column.name: id
column.remarks: ID of this entry.

column.name: key
column.remarks: The message resource key that identifies this entry along with language and region.

column.name: language
column.remarks: The language that identifies this entry along with key and region.

column.name: region
column.remarks: The region that identifies this entry along with key and language.

column.name: value
column.remarks: The message value.

column.name: recommended
column.remarks: Boolean to indicate if a mod is a high quality FAF Mod

column.name: create_time
column.remarks: When this entry was created.

column.name: update_time
column.remarks: When this entry was updated

column.name: type
column.remarks: This field can be defined for every version because maybe the author finds a way to turn his SIM mod into an UI mod.

column.name: create_time
column.remarks: When this entry was created.

column.name: update_time
column.remarks: When this entry was updated

table.name: mod_version_reviews_summary
table.remarks: Summary of all mod version reviews. Entries are created and updated by triggers.

column.name: positive
column.remarks: The 'positive' share of the rating

column.name: negative
column.remarks: The 'negative' share of the rating

column.name: score
column.remarks: The sum of all scores

column.name: reviews
column.remarks: The sum of all 'negative' and 'positive' shares. Equals to the number of reviews.

column.name: lower_bound
column.remarks: Lower bound of Wilson score confidence interval for a Bernoulli parameter

column.name: game_id
column.remarks: If equal to NULL, the offense did not happen ingame

column.name: report_status
column.remarks: The current status of the report. This will be accessable by the concerned user.

column.name: game_incident_timecode
column.remarks: The timecode of the incident ingame, indicated by the user in their own terms

column.name: moderator_notice
column.remarks: A public notice left by the moderator which will be addressed to the reporter once the report is marked as either COMPLETED or DISCARDED

column.name: moderator_private_note
column.remarks: A private notice left by the moderator which any other moderator accessing the record will be able to see.

column.name: last_moderator
column.remarks: Last moderator to have updated the report

column.name: id
column.remarks: A string that identifies the client, preferably a UUID.

column.name: name
column.remarks: Human readable client name.

column.name: client_secret
column.remarks: The client's secret, a random string.

column.name: client_type
column.remarks: A string represents if the client is confidential or public.

column.name: redirect_uris
column.remarks: A space delimited list of redirect URIs.

column.name: default_redirect_uri
column.remarks: One of the redirect uris.

column.name: default_scope
column.remarks: A space delimited list of default scopes of the client.

column.name: icon_url
column.remarks: URL to a square image representing the client.

column.name: auto_approve_scopes
column.remarks: A space delimited list of scopes that don't need to be approved by the user.

column.name: id
column.remarks: Auto incremented, technical ID.

column.name: access_token
column.remarks: A string token (UUID).

column.name: refresh_token
column.remarks: A string token (UUID).

column.name: client_id
column.remarks: ID of the client (FK).

column.name: scope
column.remarks: A space delimited list of scopes.

column.name: expires
column.remarks: Expiration time of the token.

column.name: user_id
column.remarks: ID of the user (FK).

column.name: id
column.remarks: The ID of the player achievement.

column.name: achievement_id
column.remarks: The ID of the referenced achievement (FK).

column.name: current_steps
column.remarks: The current steps for an incremental achievement.

column.name: state
column.remarks: The state of the achievement. Possible values are: "HIDDEN" - Achievement is hidden. "REVEALED" - Achievement is revealed. "UNLOCKED" - Achievement is unlocked.

column.name: id
column.remarks: ID of this entry.

column.name: player_id
column.remarks: The ID of the player that triggered this event.

column.name: event_id
column.remarks: The ID of the event definition.

column.name: count
column.remarks: The current number of times this event has occurred.

table.name: service_links
table.remarks: table representing the links to various services

column.name: user_id
column.remarks: To be set to null if account is deleted

column.name: type
column.remarks: The service that this service id links to.

column.name: service_id
column.remarks: To be set to null if account is deleted unless ownership is true

column.name: ownership
column.remarks: If true, this link confirms that the user owns FAForever. If true the link must never be deleted even if the linked account gets deleted. In this case we keep a dangling link so the id cannot be reused

table.name: table_map
table.viewSql: (select `v`.`id` AS `id`,`m`.`display_name` AS `name`,`v`.`description` AS `description`,`v`.`max_players` AS `max_players`,`m`.`map_type` AS `map_type`,`m`.`battle_type` AS `battle_type`,`v`.`width` AS `map_sizeX`,`v`.`height` AS `map_sizeY`,`v`.`version` AS `version`,`v`.`filename` AS `filename`,`v`.`hidden` AS `hidden`,`m`.`id` AS `mapuid` from (`faf`.`map` `m` join `faf`.`map_version` `v` on(`m`.`id` = `v`.`map_id`)))

table.name: table_mod
table.viewSql: select `v`.`id` AS `id`,`v`.`uid` AS `uid`,`m`.`display_name` AS `name`,`v`.`version` AS `version`,`m`.`author` AS `author`,case `v`.`type` when 'UI' then 1 when 'SIM' then 0 end AS `ui`,`v`.`create_time` AS `date`,coalesce(`s`.`downloads`,0) AS `downloads`,coalesce(`s`.`likes`,0) AS `likes`,coalesce(`s`.`times_played`,0) AS `played`,`v`.`description` AS `description`,`s`.`likers` AS `likers`,`v`.`filename` AS `filename`,`v`.`icon` AS `icon`,`v`.`ranked` AS `ranked` from ((`faf`.`mod` `m` join `faf`.`mod_version` `v` on(`m`.`id` = `v`.`mod_id`)) left join `faf`.`mod_stats` `s` on(`m`.`id` = `s`.`mod_id`)) where `v`.`hidden` = 0

column.name: date
column.remarks: When this entry was created.

column.name: teamkiller
column.remarks: login of the player who performed the teamkill

column.name: victim
column.remarks: login of the player who got teamkilled and reported the tk

column.name: game_id
column.remarks: game-id where teamkill was performed

column.name: gametime
column.remarks: time of game in seconds when tk was performed

column.name: title_key
column.remarks: The key for the title of the tutorial shown in client

column.name: description_key
column.remarks: The key for the description of the tutorial, the text in the messages table must be in HTML

column.name: image
column.remarks: The 'image'-path for to a preview image of the tutorial, relative to the base url defined in the api

column.name: ordinal
column.remarks: The 'ordinal' which defines in which order the tutorials are shown in the client (within their category)

column.name: launchable
column.remarks: Boolean that defines whether or not the tutorial can be launched

column.name: technical_name
column.remarks: The 'technical_name' of the tutorial given to the tutorial mod to decide what tutorial to start, when implemented

table.name: user_agent_stats
table.viewSql: select `l`.`user_agent` AS `user_agent`,count(1) AS `total`,count(1) / `t`.`cnt` * 100 AS `percentage` from (`faf`.`login` `l` join (select count(1) AS `cnt` from `faf`.`login` where `faf`.`login`.`id` in (select `faf`.`game_player_stats`.`playerId` from `faf`.`game_player_stats` where `faf`.`game_player_stats`.`scoreTime` between current_timestamp() - interval 30 day and current_timestamp())) `t`) where `l`.`id` in (select `faf`.`game_player_stats`.`playerId` from `faf`.`game_player_stats` where `faf`.`game_player_stats`.`scoreTime` between current_timestamp() - interval 30 day and current_timestamp()) group by `l`.`user_agent`

table.name: user_group
table.remarks: List of all user groups. Some of them are only informative (i.e. council of setons on website), others for permissions system.

column.name: technical_name
column.remarks: hardcoded names to be used in code

column.name: public
column.remarks: Public groups are visible for everyone, the rest only for internal permissions

column.name: name_key
column.remarks: name key of user group in translation table

table.name: user_group_assignment
table.remarks: Assign users (login) to a role (a bunch of permissions)

table.name: user_notes
table.remarks: Notes taken by moderators

column.name: watched
column.remarks: boolean that marks notes that should be reviewed at a later time (i.e. gather facts before applying a ban)

column.name: alternative_ordinal
column.remarks: Defines what preference for alternative voting this answer is

column.name: choice_text_key
column.remarks: With this key the 'choice_text' can be loaded from the messages table

column.name: description_key
column.remarks: The 'description-key' of the voting choice, with it additional information (HTML) can be loaded from the messages table

column.name: ordinal
column.remarks: The 'ordinal' of the voting choice, in the client choices are shown according to their ordinal value

column.name: question_key
column.remarks: With this key the 'question' can be loaded from the messages table

column.name: description_key
column.remarks: The 'description-key' of the voting question, with it additional information (HTML) can be loaded from the messages table

column.name: ordinal
column.remarks: The 'ordinal' of the voting question, in the client questions are shown according to their ordinal value

column.name: alternative_voting
column.remarks: Defines whether alternative voting applies to this question

column.name: subject_key
column.remarks: With this key the 'subject' can be loaded from the messages table

column.name: min_games_to_vote
column.remarks: The number of games a player must have to in order to vote

column.name: description_key
column.remarks: The 'description-key' of the voting subject with it additional information (HTML) can be loaded from the messages table

column.name: topic_url
column.remarks: An URL to a page with additional information, e.g. a forum post.

column.name: reveal_winner
column.remarks: When set to true after voting ended the winner is calculated and shown publicly
